summary.para: Gets information about the features that are supported by the current video driver.

param.name: FeatureVideo
param.para: A member of the enumeration that specifies the feature to query for support.

param.name: pFeatureSupportData
param.para: A structure that contains data that describes the configuration details of the feature for which support is requested and, upon the completion of the call, is populated with details about the level of support available. For information on the structure that is associated with each type of feature support request, see the field descriptions for .

param.name: FeatureSupportDataSize
param.para: The size of the structure passed to the pFeatureSupportData parameter.

returns.para: Returns S_OK if successful; otherwise, returns E_INVALIDARG if an unsupported data type is passed to the pFeatureSupportData parameter or a size mismatch is detected for the FeatureSupportDataSize parameter.

summary.para: Creates a video decoder instance that contains the resolution-independent driver resources and state.

param.name: pDesc
param.para: A pointer to a structure describing the decode profile and bitstream encryption for the decoder.

param.name: riid
param.para: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the decode video state interface.

param.name: ppVideoDecoder
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that receives a pointer to the interface.

remarks.para: Decoding a new stream requires instantiating a new decoder object.

summary.para: Allocates a video decoder heap that contains the resolution-dependent driver resources and state.

param.name: pVideoDecoderHeapDesc
param.para: A pointer to a describing the decoding configuration.

param.name: riid
param.para: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the decode video state interface.

param.name: ppVideoDecoderHeap
param.para: A pointer to a memory block that receives a pointer to the interface.

param.name: NodeMask
param.para: The node mask specifying the physical adapter on which the video processor will be used. For single GPU operation, set this to zero. If there are multiple GPU nodes, set a bit to identify the node, i.e. the device's physical adapter, to which the command queue applies. Each bit in the mask corresponds to a single node. Only 1 bit may be set.

param.name: pOutputStreamDesc
param.para: A pointer to a D3D12_VIDEO_PROCESS_OUTPUT_STREAM_DESC(ns-d3d12video-d3d12_video_process_output_stream_desc) structure describing the output stream.

param.name: NumInputStreamDescs
param.para: The number of input streams provided in the pInputStreamDescs parameter.

param.name: pInputStreamDescs
param.para: A pointer to a list of D3D12_VIDEO_PROCESS_INPUT_STREAM_DESC(ns-d3d12video-d3d12_video_process_input_stream_desc) structures the input streams. The number of structures provided should match the value specified in the NumInputStreamDescs parameter.

param.name: riid
param.para: The globally unique identifier (GUID) for the video processor interface.

param.name: ppVideoProcessor
